env.name: ENV
env.description: The logical name of the deployment, must be unique across all environments using the same shared Kafka/Elasticsearch clusters, `a-z (any case)`, `0-9`, `-`, `_` symbols only allowed

env.name: DB_HOST
env.description: Postgres hostname

env.name: DB_PORT
env.description: Postgres port

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.description: Postgres username

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: Postgres username password

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.description: Postgres database name

env.name: DB_MAXPOOLSIZE
env.description: This property controls the maximum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections

env.name: DB_MINIMUM_IDLE
env.description: This property controls the minimum number of idle connections that HikariCP tries to maintain in the pool

env.name: DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum number of milliseconds that a client will wait for a connection from the pool

env.name: DB_IDLE_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool. This setting only applies when `DB_MINIMUM_IDLE` is defined to be less than `DB_MAXPOOLSIZE`

env.name: DB_KEEPALIVE_TIME
env.description: This property controls how frequently HikariCP will attempt to keep a connection alive, in order to prevent it from being timed out by the database or network infrastructure (0 - disabled)

env.name: DB_MAX_LIFETIME
env.description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool

env.name: DB_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection will be tested for aliveness. This value must be less than the `DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT`

env.name: DB_INITIALIZATION_FAIL_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls whether the pool will "fail fast" if the pool cannot be seeded with an initial connection successfully

env.name: DB_LEAK_DETECTION_THRESHOLD
env.description: This property controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak (0 - disabled)

env.name: OKAPI_URL
env.description: Okapi URL

env.name: KAFKA_HOST
env.description: Kafka broker hostname

env.name: KAFKA_PORT
env.description: Kafka broker port

env.name: KAFKA_SECURITY_PROTOCOL
env.description: Kafka security protocol used to communicate with brokers (SSL or PLAINTEXT)

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_LOCATION
env.description: The location of the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
env.description: The store password for the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if 'ssl.keystore.location' is configured.

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_LOCATION
env.description: The location of the Kafka trust store file.

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD
env.description: The password for the Kafka trust store file. If a password is not set, trust store file configured will still be used, but integrity checking is disabled.

env.name: KAFKA_CONSUMER_MAX_POLL_RECORDS
env.description: Maximum number of records returned in a single call to poll().

env.name: KAFKA_AUTHORITY_SOURCE_FILE_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
env.description: Amount of partitions for `authority-authority-source-file` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_AUTHORITY_SOURCE_FILE_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
